token.desc: Authentication token bearing required scopes. Tokens should be passed as an HTTP Authorization header or alternatively, as a POST parameter.

external_unique_id.desc: An ID supplied by the 3rd-party Call provider. It must be unique across all Calls from that service.

external_display_id.desc: An optional, human-readable ID supplied by the 3rd-party Call provider. If supplied, this ID will be displayed in the Call object.

join_url.desc: The URL required for a client to join the Call.

desktop_app_join_url.desc: When supplied, available Slack clients will attempt to directly launch the 3rd-party Call with this URL.

date_start.desc: Unix timestamp of the call start time

created_by.desc: The valid Slack user ID of the user who created this Call. When this method is called with a user token, the `created_by` field is optional and defaults to the authed user of the token. Otherwise, the field is required.

users.desc: The list of users to register as participants in the Call. [Read more on how to specify users here](/apis/web-api/using-the-calls-api#users).

internal_error.desc: An unexpected error has occurred while trying to register the Call.

not_authorized.desc: The specified user is not authorized to create a Call in this channel.
